name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
A Chongqing netizen talked about the changes in his life situation: the couple originally had an income of about 30,000 yuan per month, so they borrowed money and took out a loan to buy a house worth 3 million yuan, renovated it for 300,000 yuan, and paid 12,700 yuan per month.
However, the good times did not last long. When the economy went down, the couple lost their jobs one after another and were forced to sell the house at a lower price. In the end, the house was sold for 2.3 million yuan.
This netizen was confused. The couple overdrew everything for the house. They did nothing, but now they are in a situation of having nothing and being in debt.
In recent years, self-narrations of defaulters can be seen from time to time on short video platforms. The changes in the lives of this couple show a microcosm of this group from the side.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Netizen contribution
It is said that the strike of Meituan riders in Shanwei has achieved its goal. On April 26, Meituan adjusted the salary plan back to the original level and promised to establish a dialogue mechanism in the future.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Later, some netizens added that the woman’s account showed that she was a professional real estate practitioner and the relevant video might be staged.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Breaking news! About an hour ago, Russia claimed that two drones from Ukraine attempted to attack Putin's residence in the Kremlin.
The video showed white smoke coming out of a building in the Kremlin.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Some netizens believe that the relevant video began to circulate after the Russian side released the news; other netizens commented that Putin was not in the Kremlin at the time of the incident, so they doubted the motive and authenticity of the incident.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
A drone crashed into the Kremlin and exploded.
https://t.co/T8juMEU50n

name: 李老师不是你老师
content:
Can text messages also be banned?
A Xiaohongshu user posted that because he sent text messages containing words such as "death" and "send wreaths" to his ex, China Telecom suspended his text messaging function for 5 months on the grounds that "the text messages may contain content that does not comply with relevant regulations and requirements."
